Notes: On May 23, 2022, the rebound alert period set by the Tokyo Metropolitan Government has been lifted. The measures involved restricting groups within restaurants to a maximum of 8 people and 2 hours.  From May 23rd, basic measures were put in place for Tokyo Metropolitan Area. These measures for uncertified restaurants continue to involve limiting a maximum number of people to 4 per group, stay for 2 hours, in addition to only serving alcoholic beverages before 9pm.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220531010302/https://www.bousai.metro.tokyo.lg.jp/1009757/1021584.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220520133826/https://www.bousai.metro.tokyo.lg.jp/_res/projects/default_project/_page_/001/021/584/20220520/20220520.pdf  https://web.archive.org/web/20220531010249/https://www.bousai.metro.tokyo.lg.jp/1009757/1021586.html

Government of Japan is looking to relax border restrictions to allow out-of-country tourists and increase daily inbound travellers from 10,000 per day to 20,000 per day. Prime Minister Kishida announced next month that he would ease the entry to the same level as the other G7 countries. However, due to the strain on the quarantine system and thus exceptions for certain inbound travellers will likely apply.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220517024812/https://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20220512/k10013622071000.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220517024809/https://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20220511/k10013620811000.html

On May 24, 2022, pilot tour groups of about 50 people from the United States, Australia, Thailand, and Singapore involving travellers who have been vaccinated three times have been permitted as foreign tourists into the country.  The government will be announcing broader plans to accept more tourists from other countries in the coming days. However, so far, only tourists on package tours with authorized tour guides are permitted.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220531005200/https://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20220524/k10013640691000.html

On May 26, 2022, the Prime Minister of Japan announces that beginning June 10, 2022, Japan will be permitting entry of foreign tourists from 98 countries which have been considered lowest risk for COVID-19 infections. However, for the time being, only travellers with authorized tour guides/conductors will be permitted.   More information about vaccination status will be coming: beginning June 10th, for travellers entering from 98 lowest risk countries, testing and quarantining will not be required even if travellers have not been vaccinated. For 99 other countries (including India and Vietnam), travellers are exempt from testing and 3-day quarantine period if they have been vaccinated 3 times. For travellers coming from Pakistan, Fiji, Albania, and Sierra Leone, travellers will be required to quarantine on entry.    Japan will also be increasing the upper limit of inbound travellers from the current 10,000 to 20,000 people from June 1, 2022.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220528015505/https://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20220526/k10013645131000.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220531011450/https://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20220527/k10013645231000.html    https://web.archive.org/web/20220531005200/https://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20220524/k10013640691000.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220531003926/https://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20220519/k10013632471000.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220531013225/https://jp.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20220531013404/https://www.mofa.go.jp/mofaj/ca/fna/page4_005130.html

For the duration of the Golden Week holidays (April 29 2022, May3-6 2022), prefectures across Japan are offering free asymptomatic PCR and rapid antigen testing from April 28 to May 8 2022. For instance, Tokyo will have 870 venues and 5 major metro stations offering testing for many people looking to travel and visiting family during the long week-long holidays.  Other prefectures offering free testing includes: Osaka, Fukuoka, Okinawa, Saitama, Kyoto, Kumamoto, Hokkaido, Shizuoka, Miyagi, Gifu, Oita, Kanagawa and more.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220502131507/https://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20220428/k10013603211000.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220503002002/https://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20220430/k10013606501000.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220503002017/https://www.pref.fukuoka.lg.jp/contents/muryou1.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220503002022/https://www.pref.saitama.lg.jp/a0710/vtppe.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220503002025/https://www.pref.kyoto.jp/kikikanri/news/corona_muryokensa.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220503002026/https://www.pref.osaka.lg.jp/kansenshokikaku/kensataisei/muryoukensa.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220503002035/https://www.pref.kumamoto.jp/soshiki/30/120272.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220503002031/https://www.pref.hokkaido.lg.jp/covid-19/kensa_muryouka.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220503002041/https://www.pref.tottori.lg.jp/301897.htm  https://web.archive.org/web/20220503002104/https://www.pref.shizuoka.jp/kousei/ko-420a/kansen/ncov-kensamuryou.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220503002110/https://www.pref.miyagi.jp/soshiki/situkan/m-kensa_ippan.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220503002124/https://www.pref.gifu.lg.jp/site/covid19/192870.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220503002137/https://www.pref.oita.jp/site/covid19-oita/muryo.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220429034838/https://www.pref.kanagawa.jp/docs/ga4/covid19/vaccines/free_pcr.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220503002137/https://www.pref.kagoshima.jp/ae06/pcrjigyousya.html

On May 23, 2022, the Japanese government no longer recommends face masks for children age 2 and younger. For preschool children over the age of 2, social distancing is no longer recommended to allow social development. In schools, masks are also not required during physical activity, including outdoor playgrounds, indoor gymnasiums, and indoor swimming pools.  For everyone else, face masks are no longer recommended outdoors if little conversation is being conducted, even if physical distancing cannot be maintained. In the summer, face mask removal is recommended to prevent over heating. Face masks are still recommended for indoor spaces however.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220531003902/https://corona.go.jp/emergency/  https://web.archive.org/web/20220526102255/https://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20220524/k10013641941000.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20220525004517/https://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20220523/k10013639521000.html

Japan is planning to administer vaccine tickets for 4th doses to those above the age of 60 with underlying illnesses beginning the end of May.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220513122038/https://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20220512/k10013621921000.html
